definition:
Let $(R,\frakm)$ be a Noetherian local ring with proper ideal $I$.
Define
$$j(I)=\lim_{n\to \infty} \frac{(d-1)!}{n^{d-1}} \length_R(H_\frakm^0(I^n/I^{n+1}))$$
and call it the j-multiplicity of $I$. Here $H_\frakm^0(\bullet)$ is the
0-th local cohomology functor. When $I$ is $\frakm$-primary, it is same
as the Hilbert-Samuel multiplicity $e_I(R)$.
